alfredsnippet.snippet:
"It is only when we try to ascertain the details of something that does not exist and conjure up all manner of explanations of wholly imaginary happenings, that we enmesh ourselves in the kind of difficulties characteristic of modern physics. The whole story is one of trying to force the universe into a pre-determined mold."

- Dewey B. Larson, The Case Against the Nuclear Atom
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - The Story of Modern Physics is that of Trying to Force the Universe Into a Pre-determined Mold
